org.tinylog.core

Class ConfigurationParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tinylog.core.ConfigurationParser

  • public final class ConfigurationParser
extends Object
    Parser for properties based configuration.
    See Also:
    Configuration

    • Method Detail

      • getLocale

        public static Locale getLocale()
        Loads the locale from configuration.
        Returns:
        Locale from configuration or Locale.ROOT if no locale is configured

      • getGlobalLevel

        public static org.tinylog.Level getGlobalLevel()
        Loads the global severity level from configuration.
        Returns:
        Severity level from configuration or Level.TRACE if no severity level is configured

      • getCustomLevels

        public static Map<String,org.tinylog.Level> getCustomLevels()
        Loads custom severity levels for packages or classes from configuration.
        Returns:
        All found custom severity levels

      • getTags

        public static List<String> getTags()
        Loads all tags from writers in configuration.
        Returns:
        Found tags

      • isWritingThreadEnabled

        public static boolean isWritingThreadEnabled()
        Detects whether writing thread is enabled in configuration.
        Returns:
        true if writing thread is explicitly enabled, otherwise false

      • isAutoShutdownEnabled

        public static boolean isAutoShutdownEnabled()
        Detects whether auto shutdown is enabled in configuration.
        Returns:
        false if auto shutdown is explicitly disabled, otherwise true

      • createWriters

        public static Collection<Writer>[][] createWriters(List<String> tags,
                                                   org.tinylog.Level minimumLevel,
                                                   boolean writingThread)
        Creates a two-dimensional matrix with all configured writers. The first dimension represents the tags. It starts with untagged writers, following with all tagged writers and ending with writers that accepts all kind of log entries. The total number of entries is the number of defined tags plus two. The second dimension represents the severity level. It starts with Level.TRACE and ends with Level.ERROR.
        Parameters:
        tags - Order of defined tags
        minimumLevel - Minimum global severity level
        writingThread - Defines whether WritingThread is enabled
        Returns:
        Matrix with all created writers
